title: X user “super pissed” that Musk ordered takeover of his @music account
description: X user quits paying for Twitter Blue to protest X commandeering his account.

title: Voyager 2 phones home and says everything is cool
description: After sending the command, NASA had to wait 37 hours for a response.

title: “Absurd”: Google, Amazon rebuked over unsupported Chromebooks still for sale
description: No security or feature updates, but selling as "new."

title: Jeanette Epps will finally go to space six years after being pulled from flight
description: NASA removed Epps from her first crew assignment in 2018 without explanation.

title: FCC prepares $75 monthly broadband subsidies for “high-cost” areas
description: $75 low-income subsidy targets areas where ISPs face "economic hardship."

title: Asahi Linux’s new “flagship” distro for M-series Macs is a Fedora Remix
description: An "upstream-first" effort on a more familiar platform.

title: Cortana, once a flagship feature of Windows phones, is slowly being shut down
description: Cortana will remain in Teams and Outlook, for now, but is going away in Windows.

title: Dude, what are those humongous plasma waves in Jupiter’s atmosphere?
description: Plasma collisions in the outer edges of Jupiter's magnetosphere produce big waves.

title: GameStop, citing “regulatory uncertainty,” winds down its crypto and NFT wallet
description: Layoffs from late last year may have hinted at company's drift away from crypto.

title: Qualcomm—one of Arm’s biggest customers—starts a RISC-V joint venture
description: The joint venture will first target automotive, with IoT and mobile coming later.

title: Thanks to AI, “Elvis” likes big butts and he cannot lie—here’s how it’s possible
description: Despite help from neural networks, it requires more human work than you might think.

title: The past and present of Los Alamos came together to make Oppenheimer
description: And some of the Oppenheimer extras were real physicists on the lab staff.

title: Fisker debuts an entire range of new EVs, including one sub-$30,000
description: As Fisker Ocean deliveries slowly start, the company is looking ahead to new things.

title: What’s going on with the reports of a room-temperature superconductor?
description: Rumors are flying of confirmation, but the situation is still frustratingly vague.

title: Frackers can use dangerous chemicals without disclosure due to “Halliburton loophole”
description: Facking industry exempt from disclosure of 28 chemicals regulated by federal law.

title: Velotric T1 e-bike review: Slick, barely-an-ebike look hides some real power
description: A winning combination of a hidden battery, smooth ride, and slick look.

title: Rocket Report: Lack of transparency on Ariane 6, Drastic cuts Down Under
description: "They should really aim for full reusability by 2026."

title: Trans-Atlantic joint venture aims to build new ‘international’ space station
description: Airbus replaces Lockheed Martin as habitat builder for the planned Starlab space station.
